meaningMnemonic: <kanji>One sided</kanji> <kanji>say</kanji>ing things means you don't know both sides of the language, causing you to speak in <vocabulary>broken language</vocabulary>, for example speaking <vocabulary>a few words</vocabulary> in <vocabulary>broken Japanese</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>broken English</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: The reading is the reading you learned for 片 and the こと of 言葉.
